Morphemic: Mae Paris yn ddinas newydd i mi.
Gloss: be.PRES.3S Paris PRED city new to me

Morphemic: Mae Iwan yn ddyn hoff iawn o siocled.
Gloss: be.PRES.3S Iwan PRED man fond very of chocolate

Comment: Such examples raise ambiguity regarding whether XP is the complement of N or the complement of A.

Morphemic: Mae ’r wefan yn [llawn o gyngor da].
Gloss: be.PRES.3S the website PRED full of advice good
Translation: The website is full of good advice.

Gloss: be.PRES.3S the website PRED advice good full of
Translation: Intended:'The website is full of good advice.'
the man who got the prize
the explosion that I heard then

Morphemic: Mae ’n ymddangos [bod llawer o dai yn y pentre ’n hen].

Translation: It appears that many houses in the village are old.
